newsitem.title: SAN MARINO: TENNIS-SPANISH SEEDS STRUGGLE IN SAN MARINO.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-SPANISH SEEDS STRUGGLE IN SAN MARINO.

text.p: Third seed Albert Portas suffered a first round exit from a clay court tournament in San Marino on Tuesday while fellow-Spaniard and top seed Felix Mantilla made heavy weather of reaching round two.
Portas, world-ranked 41, took the first set of his clash with Romanian Adrian Voinea 6-3 but then lost the second and third sets 6-4 and 6-0.
Mantilla, ranked 12th in the world, needed a third set tie-break to defeat Australia's Richard Fromberg.
The Spaniard took the first set 6-4, lost the second by the same score and then squeezed through 7-6 (7-5) in the decider.
Mantilla joins second seed and compatriot Alberto Beresategui, who beat Italian Diego Nargiso on Monday, in the next round.
